title: Portrait of Haesje Jacobsdr van Cleyburg
titles: Portrait van Haesje Jacobsdr van Cleyburgh
Portrait of Haesje Jacobsdr van Cleyburg (1583-1641). Wife of the Rotterdam Brewer Dirck Jansz Pesser (1586-1651)
description: Portret van Haesje Jacobsdr van Cleyburg (1583-1641), echtgenote van de Rotterdamse bierbrouwer Dirck Jansz Pesser (1586-1651). Buste, driekwart naar links, met een wit kapje en een dubbelgeplooide molensteenkraag. Pendant van het portret van haar echtgenoot in het Los Angeles County Museum of Art.

longTitle: Portrait of Haesje Jacobsdr van Cleyburg, Rembrandt van Rijn, 1634
subTitle: h 68.6cm × w 53.4cm
scLabelLine: Rembrandt van Rijn (1606–1669), oil on panel, 1634

label.title: Portrait of Haesje Jacobsdr van Cleyburg
label.makerLine: Rembrandt van Rijn (1606–1669), oil on panel, 1634
label.description: Haesje van Cleyburg, the wife of a wealthy Rotterdam beer brewer, is fashionably yet extremely soberly dressed. She has not been made more beautiful than she was: the wrinkles, shadows under her eyes, the bushy eyebrows, and the greying hair are all rendered with painstaking realism. What makes the portrait so charming is the faint smile that plays across her slightly parted lips.
